intro: Leptopogon furcatus, commonly known as the forked beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Leptopogon furcatus is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
